title: No results when searching via Package view selection and dialog (1GLDN1X)
description: When searching for declarations via the Package view selection and dialog, no results are returned. The package view initializes the Search dialog with the fully qualified name, which is not found when searching for declarations. However, searching via the context menu in the packages view works correctly.
OB: When searching for declarations via the Package view selection and dialog, the Search dialog is initialized with the fully qualified name which is not found.
EB: When searching for declarations via the Package view selection and dialog, the Search dialog should first try to get the Java element and if that fails, it should display the element name instead of the fully qualified name.
SR:
1. Open the Package view.
2. Select a package.
3. Right-click and choose the 'Search' option.
4. In the Search dialog, observe that the fully qualified name is displayed in the search field.
5. Perform a search.
6. Note that no results are returned.

Alternatively:
1. Open the Package view.
2. Select a package.
3. Right-click and choose the 'Search' option.
4. In the Search dialog, observe that the fully qualified name is displayed in the search field.
5. Modify the search field to display the element name instead of the fully qualified name.
6. Perform a search.
7. Observe that the expected search results are returned.
